Bug.Summery: getcfg command sometimes fails without any notification
Bug.WithStack: Running getcfg to materialize a workspace can silently fail. You just get the prompt back and everything looks OK. The workspace is not materialized though. I noticed this when materialization was unsuccesful due to pre-existing stuff on the local disk. Now extracts the result from the job and throws an exception if it was not ok .
Bug.WithOutStack: Running getcfg to materialize a workspace can silently fail. You just get the prompt back and everything looks OK. The workspace is not materialized though. I noticed this when materialization was unsuccesful due to pre-existing stuff on the local disk. Now extracts the result from the job and throws an exception if it was not ok .

Bug.Summery: buckminster metadata about components is not cleared when components are deleted
Bug.WithStack:
When deleting components ('delete content'), the buckminster metadata is not updated (i.e. removed) Apparently, a persistent property on a resource is removed prior to the PRE_BUILD and POST_CHANGE events and there are no other events that are sent when a resource is removed. Hence, there's no way to register an event handler that traps the removal of a resource that has a certain property assigned.
A redesign of the WorkspaceInfo was needed in order to keep track of the resources that reflect a component. We now maintain a Map in memory. Each time a resource is removed, it's full path (relative to the workspace) is used as the key for a lookup in this map. If a corresponding UUID is found, then we know that the resource is a component. .
Bug.WithOutStack:
When deleting components ('delete content'), the buckminster metadata is not updated (i.e. removed) Apparently, a persistent property on a resource is removed prior to the PRE_BUILD and POST_CHANGE events and there are no other events that are sent when a resource is removed. Hence, there's no way to register an event handler that traps the removal of a resource that has a certain property assigned.
A redesign of the WorkspaceInfo was needed in order to keep track of the resources that reflect a component. We now maintain a Map in memory. Each time a resource is removed, it's full path (relative to the workspace) is used as the key for a lookup in this map. If a corresponding UUID is found, then we know that the resource is a component. .

Bug.Summery: Formatter touches //-comments, even not enabled.
Bug.WithStack:
The JAVA formatter can't help re-indenting single line comments, even though comment formatting is not enabled. As I tend to write single ling comments worth a full width left-aligned at column 1 the formatted will indent all these relative to the block they're in. ;JOOP!
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 20793 *** Verified for 3.3 M7 using build I20070418-1012.

Bug.Summery: Formatter has no options for 'return'
Bug.WithStack:
Although it seems not to be an official 'style', some people write: return(expression); rather than return expression;
At the moment there is no control over the 'return' format, but automatically a space is retained after the keyword. As such is implemented for 'methods' there should be an entry that controls 'return' in the same way with respect to white space anywhere. ;JOOP! The space is optional only if the following expression is a parenthesized expression or a cast expression. Do you see another case that should be supported? (In reply to comment #1) > The space is optional only if the following expression is a parenthesized > expression or a cast expression. > Do you see another case that should be supported? If the space is optional, then why does the formatter add it in any case?
methodCall(n); // Can be parameterised to remain as this. return(version); // No way to prevent insertion of a space. Ctrl/F : methodCall(n); // Can be parameterised to remain as this. return (version); // No way to prevent insertion of a space. ;JOOP! I didn't say it was already optional. I am simply saying that if we make it optional, this option would work only for cast and parameterized expressions. For other types of expression, the space is mandatory. (In reply to comment #3) > I didn't say it was already optional. > I am simply saying that if we make it optional, this option would work only for > cast and parameterized expressions. For other types of expression, the space is > mandatory. Well, if it would solve the sample I gave, I should be satisfied. ;JOOP!
Fixed and released in HEAD. Regression case added in org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.formatter.FormatterRegressionTests.test606. This needs to be added in the code formatter preference page. See bug 111139. I will rename the option FORMATTER_INSERT_SPACE_BEFORE_PARENTESIZED_EXPRESSION_IN_RETURN.
Fixed and released. Adapted regression tests. Nothing is done for cast expression, prefix expressions or string literals. Verified for 3.2 M3 using build I20051025-0800+v_619.

(In reply to comment #1) > The space is optional only if the following expression is a parenthesized > expression or a cast expression. > Do you see another case that should be supported? If the space is optional, then why does the formatter add it in any case?

Ctrl/F : methodCall(n); // Can be parameterised to remain as this. return (version); // No way to prevent insertion of a space. ;JOOP! I didn't say it was already optional. I am simply saying that if we make it optional, this option would work only for cast and parameterized expressions. For other types of expression, the space is mandatory. (In reply to comment #3) > I didn't say it was already optional. > I am simply saying that if we make it optional, this option would work only for > cast and parameterized expressions. For other types of expression, the space is > mandatory. Well, if it would solve the sample I gave, I should be satisfied. ;JOOP!
Fixed and released in HEAD. Regression case added in org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.formatter.FormatterRegressionTests.test606. This needs to be added in the code formatter preference page. See bug 111139. I will rename the option FORMATTER_INSERT_SPACE_BEFORE_PARENTESIZED_EXPRESSION_IN_RETURN.
Fixed and released. Adapted regression tests. Nothing is done for cast expression, prefix expressions or string literals. Verified for 3.2 M3 using build I20051025-0800+v_619.

Bug.Summery: Change defaults for harware and OS to 'All'
Bug.WithStack:
Most projects in the Eclipse bugzilla are pure Java. Yet, the defaults for Hardware and OS in the bug-entry page are set according to the configuration on the reporters machine (at least I think it is). I think a more sane default for both of those values would be 'All'.
If the fields should be interpreted as 'The bug only happens on this hardware/OS', then there's a *lot* of bugs incorrectly entered today due to the defaults.
Even projects that are not entirely pure Java (platform and swt comes to mind) probably have very few bugs that truly are related to a specific hardware or OS. My guess is that they too would benefit from a default of 'All'. > If the fields should be interpreted as 'The bug only happens on this > hardware/OS', then there's a *lot* of bugs incorrectly entered today due to the > defaults.
i nterpret it rather as "i do experience that bug on that platform" -- there are probably very few people using eclipse on all supported platforms and thus being able to report a well-founded "all" as platform.
but generally i think a bug-report-wizard from inside eclipse would be far better (as most kde- applications do). there should be an entry in e g "help" called "report new bug" which opens a browser with the bugzilla using application-specific informations (hardware, os, version, ...) thus ensuring the integrity and reliabilty of these informations. (In reply to comment #1) > i nterpret it rather as "i do experience that bug on that platform" > But using Java you are in > 90% of the cases likely to experience it on other platforms as well. Look at this feature request. Who cares if I entered it using my PC and Windows XP?
IMHO, those fields should be set when it *matters*. Not otherwise.
> there are probably very few people using eclipse on all supported platforms > and thus being able to report a well-founded "all" as platform. > That's just the point. Nobody can make that claim. 'All' is equal to 'does not apply'. In essence, if you don't know, don't enter the information. A value of 'N/A' would be even better.
> but generally i think a bug-report-wizard from inside eclipse would be > far better (as most kde-applications do). there should be an entry in e g > "help" called "report new bug" which opens a browser with the bugzilla > using application-specific informations (hardware, os, version, ...) > thus ensuring the integrity and reliabilty of these informations.
That's an exceptionally great idea. Perhaps another feature request?
I agree that in many cases, the OS doesn't matter. However, I think you are underestimating how often it is relevant. There are many UI and file system subtleties that arise on various platforms. As a component maintainer, I prefer to be able to see from what platform the bug originated. I can then make the call as to whether the bug is relevant on multiple platforms. I would definitly NOT be happy if the default for hardware and OS were changed to be ALL by default. -1 !!
The hardware and OS fields should be interpreted as, "this is the environment in which I encountered the bug". The bug owner can decide whether they believe that is relevant to the bug in question. Changing the default to "all" would effectively throw away information that may prove to be valuable in some cases. I agree that for lots of Java code with no JNI component, this information does not turn out to be useful. However, as the maintainer of a large amount of file system I/O code, I can say that the behavioral differences across OSes and hardware is often significant, and I would be thrown in the dark by losing this information. You may argue that the reporter can set this information later if it matters, but in many cases the reportor simply doesn't respond to follow-up questions, so we need to gather as much information as possible in the initial report. I guess it all depends on how you interpret the fields. I've always read them as: "If you know that your problem is specific to this platform, then enter the information". I can see how your interpretation makes a lot of sense too so I'm closing this request.
Thanks for your input.

Tom Colman Belgacom Belgium I have found the source of my error.
When I checked out the project from CVS, the "Java JAR Dependencies" of my project on the other project were not checked. This is rather strange because the person who checked in the project had it checked.
After activating this dependency, the .deployables directory was correctly filled out and the exporting to WAR-file worked.
Perhaps it would be nice to give a more "user friendly" error message should this error occur.
Anyway, it works for me.
Greetings, Tom Colman
Thanks for verifying. Closing bug.

Bug.Summery: [action] Automatically Merge Bugzilla Work Items with XML Milestone Plans
Bug.WithStack: Arthur will extract information from Bugzilla and autmatically merge it with the manually written milestone_plan.xml information to produce integrated reports. If the Bugzilla information is acceptable, we can reduce some duplication of effort. Accepted. I've generated buglist-report.html documents that list the bugs for each component and target milestone. The reports link to the milestone plan items and report discrepencies. I've now linked these reports from the /webtools/plans/1.0/ index page. I'm marking this as done. However, I'd like to use PHP to apply the stylesheets but I need the Webmaster to enable it. Vote for bug 112149. Fixed. Closed.

If the Bugzilla information is acceptable, we can reduce some duplication of effort. Accepted. I've generated buglist-report.html documents that list the bugs for each component and target milestone. The reports link to the milestone plan items and report discrepencies. I've now linked these reports from the /webtools/plans/1.0/ index page. I'm marking this as done. Bug.Summery: [action] Reorganize Milestone and Test Plans on Web Site to Simplify Updates

Lines.Line: 1. We will keep the 0.7 plans in the current structure to avoid broken links.
These pages will be moved after Phoenix gives us automatic redirection
capability.
2. We will create a new directory structure for all current and future plans,
as follows:
/webtools/plans/<release>/<subproject>/<component>/<milestone>/
The directory will contain only the milestone and test plans for that component
and milestone. For example,
/webtools/plans/1.0/wst/server/M8/milestone_plan.xml
contains the milestone plan for M8 of the server component of WST in WTP 1.0.
3. Each release will be a project and have a build script. You'll only have to
check out the release portion of the Web site from CVS to update your plans.
The build script will roll up your component plans into the master plans. For
example, to update the plans for WTP 1.0, check out the project:
/webtools/plans/1.0
4. Tutorials will go into the community part of the Web site and be kept
current, i.e. we will not keep tutorials for all milestones, just the current
one. Users will be expected to upgrade to the latest milestone.
5. There are some very bulky UML models with generated HTML. These will stay in
the old directory structure. However, the source for the model (not the
generated HTML) should be checked into the development CVS repository, NOT the
Web site CVS. The HTML for the model will always be up to date, i.e we will not
have versions of the models for each milestone since they are too bulky and are
more like Javadoc than normal Web pages. If you need an old version of a model,
get it from the dev CVS.
6. Design docs will stay in the old directory structure and always reflect the

Bug.WithStack:
Arthur will reorganize the Web site as per the proposal on the mailing list:
Some of you have complained about the current process for updating the milestone and test plans since it involves checking out and building the entire Web site, which is now too bulky. Also, all Eclipse projects have been asked to clean up their sites so that the old plans are not cluttering up the Web pages.
We have been holding off doing a major reorg of the Web site because the entire Eclipse Web site is going to be upgraded by the Phoenix project. However, we need to update our 1.0 and 1.5 plans now and can't wait any longer for Phoenix.
This note proposes a new structure, cooked up by Lawrence and me, that will address the build problem and simplify cleanup at the end of each release. Please review it and respond by Thursday. In the absence of any objections voiced at our status call on Thursday, we'll proceed with the plan.
1. We will keep the 0.7 plans in the current structure to avoid broken links. These pages will be moved after Phoenix gives us automatic redirection capability.
2. We will create a new directory structure for all current and future plans, as follows:
/webtools/plans/<release>/<subproject>/<component>/<milestone>/
The directory will contain only the milestone and test plans for that component and milestone. For example,
/webtools/plans/1.0/wst/server/M8/milestone_plan.xml
contains the milestone plan for M8 of the server component of WST in WTP 1.0.
3. Each release will be a project and have a build script. You'll only have to check out the release portion of the Web site from CVS to update your plans. The build script will roll up your component plans into the master plans. For example, to update the plans for WTP 1.0, check out the project:
/webtools/plans/1.0
4. Tutorials will go into the community part of the Web site and be kept current, i.e. we will not keep tutorials for all milestones, just the current one. Users will be expected to upgrade to the latest milestone.
5. There are some very bulky UML models with generated HTML. These will stay in the old directory structure. However, the source for the model (not the generated HTML) should be checked into the development CVS repository, NOT the Web site CVS. The HTML for the model will always be up to date, i.e we will not have versions of the models for each milestone since they are too bulky and are more like Javadoc than normal Web pages. If you need an old version of a model, get it from the dev CVS.
6. Design docs will stay in the old directory structure and always reflect the current milestone, i.e. we do not have per milestone design docs. The source for the design docs should be checked in with the Java source code in the dev CVS.
7. The API Javadoc will be removed from the Web site and packaged in the Eclipse Online Help system Web site. We will add a redirect to the new location.
8. The top level Web pages will point to the current plans. We will also have a page for the archived and future plans.
The above guidelines will keep the milestone-dependent parts of the Web site lean and easy to update. Accepted. Work has begun. I have moved all the WTP 1.0 milestone and test plans into /webtools/plans/1.0 and updated all the links to these plans from /webtools/jst and /webtools/wst.
Next step is to verify that /webtools/plans/1.0 can be checked out as a project and built independently. The WTP 1.0 plans can now be checked out as a project and built independently.
The next step is to add the plans to the milestone overview and generate the reports. Then update the links to all the reports to point to the 1.0 plans. Part of a mass update. Based on 9/22/2005 development review meeting, it's determined this was an open bug/enhancement with tartget mistakenly set to M8. Since this will not be in M8, I am changing to "unspecified".
If this is an error, please correct (for example the bug really has been fixed in M8, change back to M8, and "fixed".)
The reorg is complete. However, the milestone plans will continue to be refined. I will be adding reports generated from Bugzilla. See bug 110312. I am closing this action item now. Closing.

Bug.Summery: [Contributions] [IDE] Eclipse cannot open project sometimes.
Bug.WithStack:
I am using eclipse 3.2M1. But this phenomenon was seen in R3.1 as well.
for no apparent reason eclipse did not allow me to Open Project for closed Project sometimes, the context menu item was grayed out, or even had no "Open Project" context menu item. Afte restart the Eclipse, I could solve this problem. But it will come back after restarting of eclipse several times.
This problem seem to appear randomly but some times per day. So I hope Eclipse team can do some researches on this problem, and solve it. I like Eclipse very much:)
Notes: my OS - XP JDK - JAVA 5 (maybe it's the problem?I will test this) If need, I could provide some snapshots about this problem:) I believe this is a dupe but I can't find the original bug. I THOUGHT it had been fixed some time ago, possibly in the 3.1 timeframe. Can you attach your error log?

In fact, I found this problem before several months when I use R3.1. I guessed it could be reported and fixed in 3.2M1. But not^_^ Yesterday I met a thread in a IBM web forum which said the same problem. So, I believe it's not a individual case:)
I guess 2 reasons for this problem: 1>Java5?(I using JDK 1.5.0_05-b05, but I have met this problem under b02/b03/b04) 2>plugin conflict?(But Most of plugins of my using is delivered to R3.1)
this looks a lot like bug 68179 I recheck the error log and make some tests. I highly guess this is the plugin conflict problem. I am using oxygen 6.1 plugin to deal with xml files. Today I disabled/re-enabled the oxygen. I have not met this phenomenon again. So, maybe it's just a small problem(due to the plugin, not the Eclipse itself^_^). I will make more tests recently. I hope the bug could be closed soon^_^ Today I make more tests. I am very sure that the oxygen xml editor plugin crash the "Open Project" context item of Eclipse. It should be not the bug of Eclipse. Sorry for disturbing. I like Eclipse really^_^ How to close this bug thread?I think it can be closed^_^ Closing this bug as INVALID as the bug is being logged against a different product. Thank you for investigating and clarifying this issue.

Bug.Summery: Moving components in a GridBagLayout deletes //-comment at end of add() line
Bug.WithStack:
I use the following line to add a component to a parent component
parent.add(newComp, new GridBagConstraints(...)); //@GENERATED from xyz
If I reposition newComp with the VE, the line is modified to
parent.add(newComp, gridBagConstraint42);
where gridBagConstraint42 is defined elsewhere.
The problem is: The //-comment of the add() line is removed. This should not happen because it might contain data (I use it in a code-generation tool to back-reference to the entities this line was generated from).
Bug.WithOutStack:
I use the following line to add a component to a parent component
parent.add(newComp, new GridBagConstraints(...)); //@GENERATED from xyz
If I reposition newComp with the VE, the line is modified to
parent.add(newComp, gridBagConstraint42);
where gridBagConstraint42 is defined elsewhere.
The problem is: The //-comment of the add() line is removed. This should not happen because it might contain data (I use it in a code-generation tool to back-reference to the entities this line was generated from).

Bug.Summery: Use cases for more AST recovery
Bug.WithStack:
As discussed at the JDT summit here some use cases for AST recovery.
- statement recovery
foo() ==> foo();
- method invocation recovery
foo(10, ==> foo(10) or foo(10, null, ...) where null is the default value for the missing parameters.
Having this recovery allows selecting 10 and extract it to a local or method without completing the invocation. - anonymous class recovery
Runnable runnable= new Runnable() { ru<Ctrl+Space> }
should still return node and binding for anonymous class
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 42253 *** Verified for 3.2 M5 using build I20060215-0010.

Bug.Summery: Eclipse 3.1 crashes when exiting or switching workspace
Bug.WithStack:
When installing the IBM Rational ClearCase plugin
name=Rational ClearCase SCM Adapter id=com.rational.clearcase version=2.2.1.35
(downloaded from http://www- 128.ibm.com/developerworks/rational/library/content/03July/2500/2834/ClearCase/c learcase_plugins.html, no other extra plugin installed)
the JVM crashes each time when exiting Eclipse 3.1 or switching workspaces. We would like to move on to Eclipse 3.1, but good support for ClearCase (including refactoring etc.) is crucial. Apart from the crash the plugin seems to work normally, but we are unsure, if any side effects or inconsistencies for the workspace could occur.
Changing plugin preferences (When workspace is close "Do nothing") or giving more memory to the JVM does not seem to make a difference. Is the problem reproducable in a clean Eclipse install with no additional plugins? If so, please reopen with the steps to reproduce. If not, please contact the providers of any additional installed plugins for support.

Bug.Summery: [Import/Export] Import Existing Projects should hide projects already in workspace

Lines.Line: - copy (or extract from a zip) a project to your workspace directory
- File > Import > Existing Projects into Workspace
- browse to your workspace directory
- it shows the new project, but also shows all the existing projects in the
workspace

Bug.WithStack:
3.1
- copy (or extract from a zip) a project to your workspace directory - File > Import > Existing Projects into Workspace - browse to your workspace directory - it shows the new project, but also shows all the existing projects in the workspace
It would be better if it hid the ones already in the workspace.
Note that any directory, not just the workspace directory, could have a workspace project in it due to linking, so this should work everywhere. I think there's API to look up a project file system location. Last line should read: I think there's API to look up a project by file system location.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 100733 ***

Bug.Summery: Provide control over DiagramEditPart creation from Diagram.
Bug.WithStack:
Few classes listed below perform complex initialization of graphical viewer with sole purpose to obtain DiagramEditPart:
PrintHelper.createDiagramEditPart(Diagram,PreferencesHint) CopyToImageUtil.createDiagramEditPart(Diagram,Shell,PreferencesHint) OffscreenEditPartFactory.createDiagramEditPart(Diagram)
Besides, similar initialization takes place in DiagramEditor.configureGraphicalViewer() which we opt for being generated.
It seems reasonable to allow "toolsmith" to have control over that process and to keep that functionality in a single place with explicit API.
Using IAdaptable mechanism to get DiagramEditPart (or some new dedicated interface that might respect possible uses/extra features) from Diagram would be (an Eclipse-style :) solution, e.g. existing code will change to:
DiagramEditPart createDiagramEditPart(Diagram diagram) { return (DiagramEditPart) Platform.getAdapterManager().getAdapter(diagram, DiagramEditPart.class); } Changing component to "Runtime Diagram" would be nice to have it ASAP This is not currently in our plans for 3.2. Contributions welcome...
Not yet assigned to a release (assigned to a milestone with the Plan keyword).
Moving to the next release, GMF 2.1.

Bug.Summery: MSL permanently removes listeners upon uncaught exceptions
[Validation] Validator error message mentions Schema for a DTD reference
Bug.WithStack:
1.0M8 candidate build
When validating a .tld file with this prolog: <!DOCTYPE taglib PUBLIC "-//Sun Microsystems, Inc.//DTD JSP Tag Library 1.2//EN" "http://java.sun.com/j2ee/dtd/web-jsptaglibrary_1_2.dtd">
...the system reference to the DTD is an incorrect URL, so it can't be loaded. I get this error message from the XML validator:
'The file cannot be validated as the XML Schema "http://java.sun.com/j2ee/dtd/web-jsptaglibrary_1_2.dtd" that is specified as describing the syntax of the file cannot be located.'
Problem: this file has nothing to do with schemas! Valentin, I believe you own the XML validator now. Over to you. Thanks. This seems to be still an issue with the latest WTP 3.0 M6. Message remain the same. should be fixed. Created attachment 162028 Patch to modify the validation message Patch committed and released 201003291742 UTC.
Bug.WithOutStack:
1.0M8 candidate build
When validating a .tld file with this prolog: <!DOCTYPE taglib PUBLIC "-//Sun Microsystems, Inc.//DTD JSP Tag Library 1.2//EN" "http://java.sun.com/j2ee/dtd/web-jsptaglibrary_1_2.dtd">
...the system reference to the DTD is an incorrect URL, so it can't be loaded. I get this error message from the XML validator:
'The file cannot be validated as the XML Schema "http://java.sun.com/j2ee/dtd/web-jsptaglibrary_1_2.dtd" that is specified as describing the syntax of the file cannot be located.'
Problem: this file has nothing to do with schemas! Valentin, I believe you own the XML validator now. Over to you. Thanks. This seems to be still an issue with the latest WTP 3.0 M6. Message remain the same. should be fixed. Created attachment 162028 Patch to modify the validation message Patch committed and released 201003291742 UTC.

Bug.Summery: [plan][search] Should optionaly return the local variable for type reference

source_code.code: /** * Returns other enclosing elements of this search match. * * If {@link #getLocalElement()} is not null, these may be other * local elements such as additional local variables of a multiple local * variables declaration. Otherwise, these may be other elements such as * additional fields of a multiple fields declaration. * * @return the other elements of the search match, or null if none */

Lines.Line: 1) SearchRequestor is unchanged. That means that search engine *always* reports
local element (and other elements, see below...).
Note that this behavior may change if performance tests (not written yet)
show that it's too much time consuming...
2) localElement is now implemented only on TypeReferenceMatch instead of
SearchMatch. This change has been done to avoid pollution of existing other
kind of matches as currently only type reference matches need it.
3) Add otherElements on TypeReferenceMatch to address multiple fields
declaration. Search engine reported only one match for type reference on
multiple fields declaration which was problematic for this refactoring
functionality.
Markus, note that I didn't create subclasses as we talked about. While
implementing it sounds that other elements may also be implemented at this
level as they can also be considered as specific information of a type
reference match.
4) I fixed problems with method parameters and catch exception declaration.
If I see that right, getOtherElements() will return either IFields (additional elements) or ILocalVariables (additional localElements). This should be documented, e.g.:
- org.eclipse.jdt.core
- org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.model
I just tried the patch and it works fine for temporaries and variables in for loops, but it seems getLocalElement() returns null for method parameters and exception variables:

Bug.WithStack: I20050922 The search engine should optionaly return the local variable when searching for reference to a type. This should be an option (flag on SearchEngine#search(...) ?) and the local variable should be returned using a new API (SearchMatch#getReferingElement() ?), SearchMatch#getElement() should still return the enclosing method. *** Bug 111215 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Note that bug 111225 wants type parameters as enclosing elements as well. Type parameters are currently not a requirement, but I think it would be more consistent if those would be resolved as well. We should try to deliver this soon, so UI can leverage this within M4. Created attachment 30295 Patch to implement this functionality Note that this is a workspace patch which contains 2 projects: - org.eclipse.jdt.core - org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.model I just tried the patch and it works fine for temporaries and variables in for loops, but it seems getLocalElement() returns null for method parameters and exception variables: public class Foo extends Exception { <-- search for references to "Foo" void foo(Foo foo) { // <- no local element Foo foo2; // <- local element try { throw new Foo(); } catch (Foo foo4) { // <- no local element } for(Foo foo3;;) {} // <- local element } } Created attachment 30493 New version to implement this functionality New version after a loooong discussion with Markus... ;-) Main changes are: 1) SearchRequestor is unchanged. That means that search engine *always* reports local element (and other elements, see below...). Note that this behavior may change if performance tests (not written yet) show that it's too much time consuming... 2) localElement is now implemented only on TypeReferenceMatch instead of SearchMatch. This change has been done to avoid pollution of existing other kind of matches as currently only type reference matches need it. 3) Add otherElements on TypeReferenceMatch to address multiple fields declaration. Search engine reported only one match for type reference on multiple fields declaration which was problematic for this refactoring functionality. Markus, note that I didn't create subclasses as we talked about. While implementing it sounds that other elements may also be implemented at this level as they can also be considered as specific information of a type reference match. 4) I fixed problems with method parameters and catch exception declaration. If I see that right, getOtherElements() will return either IFields (additional elements) or ILocalVariables (additional localElements). This should be documented, e.g.: /** * Returns other enclosing elements of this search match. * * If {@link #getLocalElement()} is not null, these may be other * local elements such as additional local variables of a multiple local * variables declaration. Otherwise, these may be other elements such as * additional fields of a multiple fields declaration. * * @return the other elements of the search match, or null if none */ Thanks! One more thing: Local variables inside initializers are not yet reported (local element is null). Created attachment 30567 Final patch which fixes issues described in comment 8 and comment 9 Patch released in HEAD. Test cases are in JavaSearchBugsTests . Verified for 3.2 M4 using build I20051213-0010. (new APIs still need @since 3.2 tag)

Bug.Summery: Include a macro editor with the auto gui test suite editor
Bug.WithStack:
It is currently difficult to read the macro that is included in plain text in the test suite editor.
A 4th page should be included that displays the macro in a styled text with proper colouring and formatting. A tree representation of the xml fragment would also be useful. Moving the priority to 1.
Description Document: http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/groups/Architecture/documents/features/hf_110337.html I suspect you don't use EMF for this editor. Would be better if you can create a schema for the macro XML and use EMF to generate the editor (based on EMF.Edit and EMF.Editor frameworks), you'll get a very rich editor with undo/redo capabilities and Properies view integration.
Your icons have a + decorator on them what it means? (In reply to comment #2)
> Your icons have a + decorator on them what it means?
The tree view includes the shell and the individual commands that fall under them. e.g. The user modifying a text box and pressing the ok button on the dialog will appear as:
TestCase |__ Wizard Dialog ID |__ modify (Line Number: x-x) |__ select (Line Number: x-x)
Why do you need + decorator on the leaf nodes? The leaf nodes don't have a + on them. You're probably talking about "CreateProbeFile", "WorkingWithProbesAndImports", and etc... These aren't leaf nodes. They're test cases. The leaf nodes are item-select, select, modify, etc... Setting the target milestone to 4.1i1. This was approved by PMC. It was also AG reviewed by Harm S. Checked into CVS. Used the same feature to update the user guide document. ACTION: Please verify/close this defect. Closing by default since not closed by the originator in the 7+ months since being resolved.
Please reopen if the issue is still present in the latest TPTP release or the resolution is not correct.

Bug.Summery: Diagram links support for diagram based on a resource

Lines.Line: 1. Ability to create Link to Diagram EObject, independent of its container
(EResource/EObject).
2. Diagram links should get renamed, when diagram is renamed.
3. Ability to create Link to files. Useful when diagrams are stored at root
level, and client uses files as means to navigate to diagrams.
4. Diagram Links should get renamed, when the file is renamed.
5. Ability to drag and drop a diagram EObject or file on the diagram, to get a
diagram link.
6. Ability to drag and drop a diagram EObject or file on the Note, to get a
diagram link.
7. Ability to double click on the diagram/file link, to open a diagram or file
with its default editor.
8. Ability to cut/copy/paste diagram links onto the same diagram or different
diagrams.
9. Ability to drag and drop another diagram onto an existing link to relink to
the dropped diagram.
1. Deleting of the file should delete the file link to that file in all open and
close diagrams.
2. Deleting of the diagram should delete the diagram link to that diagram in all
open and close diagrams.
3. Deleting of the file containing the linked diagram EObject, should result in
changing the state of link to unresolved.
4. When the link target is missing, then the diagram link should show Unresolved
decoration (X sign).
5. Convert a file diagram link to regular Diagram EObject link and a Diagram
EObject link to a file link.
6. Delete from Model on a file link should delete the linked file.
7. Delete from Model on a diagram eobject link should delete the Diagram EObject.

Bug.WithStack:
Need infrastructure support for create a diagram links that link to a file resource.
Use case: - drag and drop a logic diagram onto another logic diagram.
Result: - a text diagram link is create then when double clicked will open the dragged diagram. Changing component to "Runtime Diagram" Diagram/File Link Features: 1. Ability to create Link to Diagram EObject, independent of its container (EResource/EObject). 2. Diagram links should get renamed, when diagram is renamed. 3. Ability to create Link to files. Useful when diagrams are stored at root level, and client uses files as means to navigate to diagrams. 4. Diagram Links should get renamed, when the file is renamed. 5. Ability to drag and drop a diagram EObject or file on the diagram, to get a diagram link. 6. Ability to drag and drop a diagram EObject or file on the Note, to get a diagram link. 7. Ability to double click on the diagram/file link, to open a diagram or file with its default editor. 8. Ability to cut/copy/paste diagram links onto the same diagram or different diagrams. 9. Ability to drag and drop another diagram onto an existing link to relink to the dropped diagram.
More Features: 1. Deleting of the file should delete the file link to that file in all open and close diagrams. 2. Deleting of the diagram should delete the diagram link to that diagram in all open and close diagrams. 3. Deleting of the file containing the linked diagram EObject, should result in changing the state of link to unresolved. 4. When the link target is missing, then the diagram link should show Unresolved decoration (X sign). 5. Convert a file diagram link to regular Diagram EObject link and a Diagram EObject link to a file link. 6. Delete from Model on a file link should delete the linked file. 7. Delete from Model on a diagram eobject link should delete the Diagram EObject.
Need to add a generic diagram parser for the name at the GMF level. It should be resilient to whether the diagram semantic reference is unresolved or not. Utilizing something similar to EObject#getName... Use case for verification after enhancement: -create two simple projects Proj1 and Proj2 -create a logic diagram in each -logic1, and logic2 -drag logic1 onto logic2 -close Proj 2. -close environment -open environment, open logic1 -notice you will have a diagramLink to logic2 with proper name even though it is unresolved. (proper behavior). Moving to M6. Not enough time left in M5 to address this. Descoped from M6 Can we assign this to 2.0? I agree that this one should probably go 2.0.
Anthony and I will go over the Runtime enhancements requests after our respective vacation; no need to sweep them :-) *** Bug 121073 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Not yet assigned to a release (assigned to a milestone with the Plan keyword).
Moving to the next release, GMF 2.1.

Bug.Summery: [Help] Sometimes can't print HTML/PDF docs in XP-SP2 when firewall on
Bug.WithStack:
When trying to print an HTML help doc in XP with Firewall enabled. After clicking OK to print, an IE Script Error message appears: An error occurred in the script on this page. Ln: 1184 Char: 1 Error: Unspecified Error, Code: 0 URL: res://C:\Windows\System32\shdoclc.dll/preview.dlg
This occurred on WinXP-SP2 machine, didn't on Win2000-SP4 machine... and the pages did not print. Note that I had originally (purposely) chosen 'Keep Blocking' when I got XP Firewall message first time I opened Help.
Turning off Firewall in XP fixed the problem, although attempting to modify firewall settings to not affect eclipse didn't work (unless I'd missed or not done something properly).
I've found that PDFs seem to have a similar issue. Given you have the Firewall on, if you start the IDE, go to Help, and try to print a PDF will fail and you'll get the message: "The document could not be printed." At the moment, I'm only getting this failure on the first attempt to print since last starting the IDE. After the failed attempt, I can print w/o problems. However, I did earlier (and I don't now) get the "Can't print" behaviour repeatedly until I tried printing the same page again in which case it seems to have switched to this new improved behaviour. Similar to the HTML issue, it seems that whether you block or unblock, you can only count on ~100% printing reliability if you turn off the XP firewall. This problem didn't occur on Win2000-SP4.
Basically, I've found that PDFs seem to have a similar issue. Given you have the Firewall on, if you start the IDE, go to Help, and try to print something in the "Printable" PDF version, printing will fail and you'll get the message: "The document could not be printed."
At the moment, I'm only getting this failure on the first attempt to print since last starting the IDE. After the failed attempt, I can print w/o problems. However, I did earlier (and I don't not now) get the "Can't print" behaviour repeatedly until I tried printing the same page again in which case it seems to have switched to this new improved behaviour.
Similar to the HTML issue, it seems that whether you block or unblock, you can only count on ~100% printing reliability if you turn off the XP firewall. This problem didn't occur on Win2000-SP4. I would suggest trying to allow Help to connect. Eclipse Help system uses Tomcat server to serve out help pages on localhost address. Help is not really trying to connect anywhere outside). The help system no longer uses Tomcat. Resolving as WONTFIX.

Bug.Summery: Address the changes in the XML namespace schema.
Bug.WithStack:
The public version of http://www.w3.org/2001/xml.xsd has changed from http://www.w3.org/2001/03/xml.xsd to http://www.w3.org/2005/08/xml.xsd. In particular, this changes the type of xml:lang to not be just xsd:Language anymore.
We need to update XMLNamespacePackage to reflect this. The changes to the XML Namespace package have been committed as well as the updated cached schemas in the xsd plugin. Fixed in 2.2.0 I200509290200 Move to verified as per bug 206558.
Bug.WithOutStack:
The public version of http://www.w3.org/2001/xml.xsd has changed from http://www.w3.org/2001/03/xml.xsd to http://www.w3.org/2005/08/xml.xsd. In particular, this changes the type of xml:lang to not be just xsd:Language anymore.
We need to update XMLNamespacePackage to reflect this. The changes to the XML Namespace package have been committed as well as the updated cached schemas in the xsd plugin. Fixed in 2.2.0 I200509290200 Move to verified as per bug 206558.

Bug.Summery: Customize layout should let me change layout property
Bug.WithStack:
If I want to fiddle with the layout of an object, it seems unnatural to have to change the layout property in the properties view, and then go to "Customize Layout" to set other stuff. Noel, All the properties of a layout are in available in the property sheet (PS) view. If there are properties missing in the PS and are in the Customize Window for that layout, this is a bug. Please note them here and I'll aim to fix them in the next release.
For layout settings and manipulation, the PS is the very basic way to change to the properties of either the containers layout or the layout "constraints" of the children (e.g. "NORTH", "SOUTH", etc. for BorderLayout). VE provides the Customize Window for certain layouts in order to help categorize and display some of the most commonly edited properties of either the layout or the contraints. For example, the GridBagConstraints used for children of a container with GridBagLayout can be fairly complex, so all the properties are provided in the Customize Window with visual helps (such as the compass for the anchor property). Of course, VE provides settings by just drag/drop and moving components within these containers. The Customize Window is there for settings that can't be done alone in the graph view through manipulating the components. If you have suggestions for how the VE can improve the user experience in this area, please add them to this bug report. Thanks... Peter Walker I guess I am just used to the Netbeans VE, which has a drop-down for changing the layout manager on the "customize layout" dialog.
It just seems counter-intuitive to have to go somewhere else.
(I am not saying that the property-sheet should not display the layoutManager property - just that when I right click "customize layout" and I can't change the layout, at first I was very confused.) Sorry... I misunderstood the problem. I thought you were talking about changing the properties of a specific layout. And yes... you are correct in that it is very inconvenient to have to change the layout in the property sheet and then go to the Customize Layout window to work with it more.
In VE 1.2, we have made changes to improve this: There are separate VE preferences pages for both Swing and SWT that allows you to select the default layout manager you would like to use when you drop a container (e.g. JPanel). So instead of using the default FlowLayout (default layout manager for JPanel), you can select GridBagLayout as your default. Also, to make it easier to change the layout once you've dropped it the container, a drop down menu was added next to the toolbar action on the main Eclipse toolbar for 'Customize Layout'. This drop down meny works the same as the property sheet drop down menu for the 'layout' property.
What I believe you are suggesting here is to add the capability to change the layout from the Customize Layout window itself. This is a good suggestion and we'll look at it for an enhancement in 1.2. One additional capability I failed to mention is a 'Set Layout' cascading menu tha was added to the context menu of the container... allowing you another way to change the layout manager without having to go to the property sheet view. All these changes were recently added and should be available in the next 1.2 build. Peter, In the current HEAD the "Set layout>" is not on the Container/Composite sub menu any more. There is a drop down list beside the button that launches the customize dialog, and this shows the availabe layout/layout managers together with an option to open the preferences page and change the default. Can't remember the exact reason why the "set layout" pop-up was taken off, but it could easily be added back on if we want to. Joe

Bug.Summery: SWT Example Launcher: Double-click on "Standalone" folder produces a "Could not instantiate the class to run" log

Stacktrace.Reason: Executable extension definition for "mainClass" not found.

Lines.Line: - Install Eclipse 3.1 with SWT Examples
- From Eclipse workbench, go to Window -> Show View -> Other ...
- Expand SWT Examples and select SWT Example Launcher. Click OK.
- From the SWT Example Launcher view, double-click the "Standalone" folder
(under Examples) to open it.

Bug.Summery: JTabbedPane: generated addTab calls should use minimal method
Would be nice to be able to ACK warnings
Bug.WithStack:
The value of warnings in the U/I becomes diluted in cases where you want to live with particular instances of warnings. For instance, if you want to deprecate an interface your code is supplying, then all the code implementing or referring to that interface is flagged by valid warnings. However, we actually want to leave those warnings in place because we may have legacy users referring to that interface and they need to migrate off of it.
It would be great if we could acknowledge warnings on a per-instance basis. The acknowledged warnings would suppress the percolated warning flags at the package and directory level - but might still show as slightly different markers within a file. This way, the percolated warning flags retain their value.
Perhaps the acknowledged warning could contain a note from the user who ack'd it for documentation purposes.

i don't know how eclipse behaves on other systems than WinXP, but i would like to be able to use the ide WITHOUT HAVING TO BE ADMINISTATOR ON THE SYSTEM. this is a real security issue to me and a lot others i know. even ibm variant (rational app dev 6.0) is not able to launch testservers in the ide if the current user doesn't inherit admin rights to the ide.
any comments / hints?

Bug.Summery: [evaluation] auto completion does not work for inherited private attributes
[Import/Export] ImportExistingTest introduces incorrect layout data
Bug.WithStack:
On Solaris, 6 of the ImportExistingTests fail with FormLayout tring to cast GridData to FormData.
We add a composite to a shell in ImportExistingTest#getNewWizard():
wpip.createControl(shell);
but WizardProjectsImportPage#createControl(...) expects it's parent to be a GridLayout, and our shell is a FormLayout.
It's wrong on all the platforms, but it only shows up on Solaris because it gets some extra layout() events from the OS.
PW These tests are going to be re-written. see bug 100693
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 100693 ***

Bug.Summery: clientActive() callback method is never called

Lines.Line: - There is a work around. The agent can send a CustomCommand at initialization step to indicate that it is ready to do business
- This function has never been implemented and the above workaround is typically implemented by our customers.

Bug.WithStack:
In the RAC callback interface RemoteClientListener, two methods are defined: clientAtive() and clientInactive(). The latter is called when an agent is detached in the UI, giving the impression that the former will be called when a UI attaches to the agent.
The clientActive() method is never called, which prevents its user from detecting the correct state of UI. This is particularly an issue if the agent is trying to perform different actions based on whether the agent is being attached to or not. One example of the breakage caused by this is dynamic discovery, in which a new agent will be dynamically discovered if it is not attached to.
To the best of my knowledge, there is no workaround for this problem.
Our project will need this fixed in TPTP 4.2. Samson confirms that this is not a regression (it has, unfortunately, always behaved this way). Based on that and on the fact that Qiyan's project is picking up 4.2 rather than 4.1, this is being retargeted to 4.2 as per his comment. Qiyan, would you please give us a clearer use-case scenario for this new feature you are asking. I know it has something to do with dynamic discovery, but a more detailed use-case would help avoid misunderstanding the scenario. Thanks. There are call backs methods an agent can implement so that it will be informed of certain events. For instance, when a user starts monitoring an agent, monitorActive() from MonitorListener class is called. Similarly, when a client is attached/detached, clientActive() and clientInactive() from RemoteClientListener should be called. However, the clientActive() method is never called when a client is attached to. Without this event, an agent cannot always determine its state correctly.
This interface has been in TPTP for a long time. So this is not a new feature. Reducing severity to major for the following reasons: - There is a work around. The agent can send a CustomCommand at initialization step to indicate that it is ready to do business - This function has never been implemented and the above workaround is typically implemented by our customers.
Copying to Kevin so that he is aware of this issue One scenario where this is a problem is when dynamic discovery is involved.
Suppose that agents A and B are both involved in a distributed transcaction and that the user manually attach both agents from the workbench. Then the user would start monitoring A but not B. If the transcaction starts from A and then goes to B, dynamic discovery will tell the workbench to attach to B. Since agentActive() is not called when the user manually attaches to B, B believes it is in the detached state, causing the dynamic discovery mechanism to be invoked for each distributed transcaction. From the user's point of view, this means the transcaction will be slowed down significantly for no particular reason. (In reply to comment #5) > One scenario where this is a problem is when dynamic discovery is involved. > > Suppose that agents A and B are both involved in a distributed transcaction and > that the user manually attach both agents from the workbench. Then the user > would start monitoring A but not B. If the transcaction starts from A and then > goes to B, dynamic discovery will tell the workbench to attach to B. Since > agentActive() is not called when the user manually attaches to B, B believes it > is in the detached state, causing the dynamic discovery mechanism to be invoked > for each distributed transcaction. From the user's point of view, this means > the transcaction will be slowed down significantly for no particular reason. >
Qiyan, I thought it is the clientActive() callback is not called, not agentActive(). Transfering to 4.3 per conversation with Qiyan. My bad. It was supposed to be clientActive() not agentActive(). Not containable in 4.3 and retarget to 4.4. Please let me know if you have any concern.

Bug.Summery: Missing image for marked occurrences in vertical ruler
Bug.WithStack:
When I find All Occurrences in File, the image on the vertical ruler doesn't show. I get the little red square in both JSPs and XML files. I think something changed in the base. It appeared to be working fine when i had eclipse 3.1 as my base, but when I changed it to 3.1.1, it broke. I'm still not sure what caused this to break between 3.1 and 3.1.1, but I did find a solution.
I noticed in StructuredResourceMarkerAnnotationModel#createMarkerAnnotation, a StructuredMarkerAnnotation was always being created. StructuredMarkerAnnotation exists to work around an issue with problems/validation and breakpoints. So really, a StructuredMarkerAnnotation should only be created when you are dealing with a problem/validation or breakpoint markers. Otherwise, just create the default marker annotation by calling super.createMarkerAnnotation. This means markers for bookmarks, tasks, search will all use the default marker annotation. And all the info, including icons will be found correctly and automatically. Created attachment 27906 StructuredResourceMarkerAnnotationModel
This is the main fix.
protected MarkerAnnotation createMarkerAnnotation(IMarker marker) { if (MarkerUtilities.isMarkerType(marker, IBreakpoint.BREAKPOINT_MARKER) || (MarkerUtilities.isMarkerType(marker, IMarker.PROBLEM))) { return new StructuredMarkerAnnotation(marker); } return super.createMarkerAnnotation(marker); } Created attachment 27907 StructuredMarkerAnnotation
This patch is optional and it removes references to bookmarks, tasks, search since this marker annotation should never be used for these type of markers anymore. Created attachment 27908 TemporaryAnnotation
This one's also optional. Removes references to bookmarks, tasks, search since these types of annotations should not really be needed as temporary annotations. This included the following public static constants: TemporaryAnnotation#ANNOT_BOOKMARK TemporaryAnnotation#ANNOT_SEARCH TemporaryAnnotation#ANNOT_TASK Reassigning to Phil to apply patches.
Phil, I assigned these to you since you have knowledge on TemporaryAnnotations and such. I just want to make sure I made the right assumption that temporary annotations and structured marker annotations are only needed for breakpoints and validation info. And that bookmarks, tasks, search are all okay with using what the base provides.
If the patches are okay, could you please apply? Thanks. I tested a bit and saw no problems. I applied the patches. Verified in 1.0rc4.

Bug.Summery: [WorkbenchParts] NPE dragging view from fast view bar.

Bug.Summery: context info no longer bolds existing attributes
Bug.WithStack:
(ctrl + shift + space) for a tag <a href |> previously used to bold all the existing atrributes (href in this case).
This also used to work as you typed the atributes or content assisted them. This feature (bolding) seems to be broken now. What's "bolding" for? Just readability?
So you can easily tell which attributes are already present in the tag, and which ones are available to be added still. *** Bug 158832 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Created attachment 60389 jsp.ui.javascript.ui.sse.ui.patch
The IContextInformationPresenter wasn't being used and when it was, the wrong contextinformation object was being passed in (a wrapped compoundcontextinformation instead of the real contextinformation). See bug 124983.
While investigating this bug, I also noticed java parameter help no longer worked (see bug 111876 for an example of how it did work). This was because getContextInformationPosition() in our CustomCompletionProposals was returning the wrong position. So that's fixed too with this bug. fix checked in for this week's 2.0 m6 ibuild verified in wtp2.0 M6 200704021416

(ctrl + shift + space) for a tag <a href |> previously used to bold all the existing atrributes (href in this case).
This also used to work as you typed the atributes or content assisted them. This feature (bolding) seems to be broken now. What's "bolding" for? Just readability?
So you can easily tell which attributes are already present in the tag, and which ones are available to be added still. *** Bug 158832 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Created attachment 60389 jsp.ui.javascript.ui.sse.ui.patch
The IContextInformationPresenter wasn't being used and when it was, the wrong contextinformation object was being passed in (a wrapped compoundcontextinformation instead of the real contextinformation). See bug 124983.
While investigating this bug, I also noticed java parameter help no longer worked (see bug 111876 for an example of how it did work). This was because getContextInformationPosition() in our CustomCompletionProposals was returning the wrong position. So that's fixed too with this bug. fix checked in for this week's 2.0 m6 ibuild verified in wtp2.0 M6 200704021416

Bug.Summery: WSDL editor content assist not working if WSDL schemas are not explicitly added to the XML catalog
Bug.WithStack:
WSDL editor content assist not working if WSDL schemas are not explicitly added to the XML catalog. If the WSDL schemas are not present, they should be cached by the internet cache, and the editor can use the cached copy to provide content assist. When resolving URI editor content model does not call URIResolver.resolvePhysicalLocation, which actually is responsible for accessing the cache.
I'm attaching a patch for XMLModelQueryAssociationProvider. The fix is in resolveGrammarURI method. I'd like Craig and Lawrence to review it. Created attachment 27416 patch for XMLModelQueryAssociationProvider Lawrence, can you review Ella's patch? Thanks. The patch looks OK but is there a reason that the resolve method must be called before the resolvePhysical method? The resolvePhysical method is meant for when you want to get an actual location as the result of resolution (which, as I understand it, is what the editor needs to do in this case). Is the catalog not included in the resolvePhysical method call? If not, this patch looks good for now and we should correct the registration of the catalog with the framework in M9. Yes, XMLCatalogURIResolverExtension was contributed to "postnormalization" stage, but not to "physical" stage. We have to reconcile that. Thanks Ella and Lawrence. The patch seems safe enough. I've done some testing with the 0923 driver + patch, content assist now works. David, fix approved for 0.7.1? Yes, approved. But, please note in the patched code itself, and open a new bug to track Ella's comment about "XMLCatalogURIResolverExtension was contributed to "postnormalization" stage, but not to "physical" stage. We have to reconcile that.".
Hopefully having that open will help us reconcile the reconciler :) and, helpfully, remember places in the code ot fix once its done.
Thanks. Fix commited and released. Closing bug.

Bug.Summery: Duplicate <feature> entries in eclipse 3.0 site.xml

It was pointed out that this entry is duplicated in the eclipse 3.0 site.xml
<feature url="features/org.eclipse.sdk.examples_3.0.1.jar" patch="false" id="org.eclipse.sdk.examples" version="3.0.1"> <category name="3.0.1" /> </feature>

Bug.Summery: [SSH] Pressing Cancel in CVS Compare Progress Dialog does nothing
Bug.WithStack:
When wanting to open the compare editor out of the Synchronization perspective, you will get "Progress Information: Opening Compare Editor".
In case the connection is slow and close to a timeout, pressing Cancel does nothing. You have to wait until the Connection Timeout is reached. So you can not work until this timeout is reached.
Only workaround for me is to disable my network device, or shutdown eclipse by killing the task.
Ben What connection method are you using? I am using "extssh" on the default port.
Btw this is SourceForge CVS which is known to sometime give timeouts after a very long time. If this is the case, Eclipse is waiting until the timeout, even if Cancel was hit.
Ben
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 68012 ***

Bug.Summery: Unable to view the Pointcut description for AdviceElement and DeclareElement

source_code.code: pointcut aexec(): execution( public void D.a());
> pointcut aexec(): execution( public void D.a());

Bug.WithStack:
The "AdviceElement" and "DeclareElement" in org.eclipse.ajdt.core.model.AJModel only give the name of the selected Element.
For instance, from the following lines of code:
pointcut aexec(): execution( public void D.a()); before(): aexec() { }
The AdviceElement corresponding to "before(): aexec() { }" only reveals the infromation "before( )". It would be extremely useful if the "AdviceElement" and the "DeclareElement" exposed the associated pointcut as well.
I am attaching the email thread below in context of which I have raised this request:
Hi Irum,
Hmm, currently it's not that easy - you'd have to go from the source code of the element, to get the string, then extract the names of any pointcuts, and then locate those pointcuts. We're working on some pointcut utilities, and we should probably add an easy way to get the string from the advice element. But I think there's an even better way, which is for us to expose the "uses pointcut" relationship that is down in ajde - then you could go straight from an AdviceElement to a list of PointcutElements. Please raise an enhancement request, and we'll look into it.
Regards,
Matt.
On 22/09/05, Irum Godil <softwarengineer2004@yahoo.com> wrote: > > Hi, > I am working on developing a plugin, that will display the "advice" and > "declare" elements together with the associated named or anonymous pointcut > on which they operate. I am using the > org.eclipse.ajdt.core.model.AJModel class, and I am able to > get all the "AdviceElements" and "DeclareElements" inside an aspect. > However, these elements only give me the name of the selected Element. > > For instance, from the following lines of code: > > pointcut aexec(): execution( public void D.a()); > before(): aexec() { } > > The AdviceElement corresponding to "before(): aexec() { }" only reveals the > infromation "before( )". I am unable to find APIs that will give me the > pointcut associated with it, i.e. "aexec" in the above case. > > Can someone please tell me if I can get the pointcut information for an > associated "AdviceElement", and which APIs to use? Fixed. The AJDT model now contains "uses pointcut" and "pointcut used by" relationships. These can be shown in the Cross References and Crosscutting Comparison views, although they are filtered out by default - you can adjust the filters to see them. The relationships can of course also be queried programmatically just like the "advises" etc relationships - for an example see testUsesPointcutRels() in AJModelTest2.java in the org.eclipse.ajdt.core.tests project.

Bug.Summery: Line numbers missing from SourceMethod
Bug.WithStack:
I am trying to create a plugin to display information regarding matches of "DeclareElements" and "AdviceElements". I am using the APIs AJModel.getInstance().getRelatedElements(). When the matched element is a "method call" somewhere, the matched element is a "AJCodeElement" and I am able to get all the information such as Line numbers etc. from it. However, when the matched element is a "SourceMethod" as in the case of a method execution pointcut, the line number is not available.
If the line number was available from the "SourceMethod" it would be really helpful for my plugin UI display. Changes to it will be very useful. Irum, I don't think we can help with this one, as SourceMethod is a JDT type, outside of our control. You could make a request to the JDT team to add line number information, but I don't believe they would consider it appropriate because Eclipse types generally work with offsets into the buffer instead of line numbers. So you could at least call getSourceRange() on the SourceMethod, and then get the length and offset from that. You can translate an offset into a line number by scanning through the contents of the buffer, but of course that might not be too efficient, unless the buffer has already been loaded.

I am trying to create a plugin to display information regarding matches of "DeclareElements" and "AdviceElements". I am using the APIs AJModel.getInstance().getRelatedElements(). When the matched element is a "method call" somewhere, the matched element is a "AJCodeElement" and I am able to get all the information such as Line numbers etc. from it. However, when the matched element is a "SourceMethod" as in the case of a method execution pointcut, the line number is not available.
If the line number was available from the "SourceMethod" it would be really helpful for my plugin UI display. Changes to it will be very useful. Irum, I don't think we can help with this one, as SourceMethod is a JDT type, outside of our control. You could make a request to the JDT team to add line number information, but I don't believe they would consider it appropriate because Eclipse types generally work with offsets into the buffer instead of line numbers. So you could at least call getSourceRange() on the SourceMethod, and then get the length and offset from that. You can translate an offset into a line number by scanning through the contents of the buffer, but of course that might not be too efficient, unless the buffer has already been loaded.

Bug.Summery: [preferences] Improve affordance to find content assist type filters
Bug.WithStack:
I'd like to filter out packages/classes from content assist that I won't ever select.
When working with SWT, I find I frequently accidentally select the java.awt homonym, e.g. Button, FlowLayout. This also happens when selecting List (java. awt.List is at the top of the list). you can already do that on the Java -> Appearance -> Type Filter page
(In reply to comment #1) > you can already do that on the Java -> Appearance -> Type Filter page >
Yes, you can already do that _but_ you have to know that the Type Filter page exists and where it is or that typing 'Filter' in the Preferences search tool will find the page AND you need to know that the Type Filter page is where this filtering is configured. There is _nothing_ in the Content Assist page that indicates the possibility of filtering. The only way to find out is to look at the help (and search for "Content Assist" - not just navigate to the "Content Assist" section).
This proposed enhancement is about making it easier to configure "Content Assist".
An alternative is to add the "Type Filter" page when "Content Assist" is typed into the Preferences search tool.
Please consider reopening this entry. I rename the request to improve the preference page. One possibility is to add a link from the code assist preference page to type filters. Added a link and a preference page keyword to find the Type Filter page when entering "content assist".
Fixed in HEAD. Available in builds > N20071022-0010. *** Bug 177723 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Bug.Summery: Can't access DataSource in beforeOpen event from script
Bug.WithStack:
The ROM_SCRIPTING_SPEC.pdf says:
a DataSource object can be accessed from the dataSources property of the report object, which provides a list of data sources keyed by name. If a data source is called “SalesDB”, the application can access it as: ds = report.dataSources[“SalesDB”] or ds = report.dataSources.SalesDB
this does not work for me,
The use case is as follows
create a Datasource, next select the data source, and in the report designer select the beforeOpen event. next in the script editor type in the example from the ROM spec like
ds = report.dataSources[“DS2”]
I get the following error
There are errors on the report page:Error1:Invalid Javascript expression. Source: DataSource:DS2.beforeOpen, line: 0, Expression:function_prefix_1127342608534();function function_prefix_1127342608534(){ds = report.dataSources[“DS2”]}Script engine error: illegal character
so I also tried the other method mentioned,
ds = report.dataSources.DS2
this also generates an error

Bug.Summery: libpiAgent.so missing from z/OS Agent Controller zip due to build error
Bug.WithStack:
libpiAgent.so missing from the latest z/OS Agent Controller zip due to the following build error:
cxx -W c,NOSEARCH,CSECT -W c,NOLOCALE,LANGLVL\(EXTENDED\) -W c,LONGNAME -W c,DLL,EXPORTALL -W c,TARGET\(OSV2R10\),XPLINK -O -Wc,"CONVLIT(ISO8859-1)" - D_OPEN_SYS -DENW -D_XOPEN_SOURCE_EXTENDED=1 -DSQLUNIX=1 -DMVS=1 - D_OPEN_THREADS -D_ALL_SOURCE -I./framework/HCLauncher -I./framework/RABindings - I./framework/RACommon -I./framework/RADataTransfer -I./framework/RAServer - I./framework/RAServerConfig -I./framework/RAServerTypes - I./framework/RASharedMemory -I./framework/RASocket -I./../cbe/cImpl - I../../depends/java/include -I../../depends/java/include/os390 - I../../depends/xercesc/include -c collectors/native/java_profiler/StatelessHeapSnapshotManager_C.cpp -o collectors/native/java_profiler/StatelessHeapSnapshotManager_C.o "./collectors/native/java_profiler/../heapsnapshots/StatelessHeapSnapshotManager .h", line 23.11: CBC1090(S) Syntax error - expected "type name" and found "bool". "./collectors/native/java_profiler/../heapsnapshots/StatelessHeapSnapshotManager .h", line 42.12: CBC1320(S) Syntax error - found "bool _optHeapDebug" : "bool" is not a type name. "./collectors/native/java_profiler/../heapsnapshots/StatelessHeapSnapshotManager .h", line 18.7: CBC1222(S) "StatelessHeapSnapshotManager" needs a constructor because base class "AbstractHeapSnapshotManager" needs a constructor initializer. "./collectors/native/java_profiler/StatelessHeapSnapshotManager_C.cpp", line 36.13: CBC1263(S) Syntax error - expected ";" or "," and found "optHeapDebug". "./collectors/native/java_profiler/StatelessHeapSnapshotManager_C.cpp", line 537.9: CBC1013(S) Identifier "optHeapDebug" is undefined. "./collectors/native/java_profiler/StatelessHeapSnapshotManager_C.cpp", line 631.7: CBC1013(S) Identifier "optHeapDebug" is undefined. "./collectors/native/java_profiler/StatelessHeapSnapshotManager_C.cpp", line 637.7: CBC1013(S) Identifier "optHeapDebug" is undefined. "./collectors/native/java_profiler/StatelessHeapSnapshotManager_C.cpp", line 643.7: CBC1013(S) Identifier "optHeapDebug" is undefined. "./collectors/native/java_profiler/StatelessHeapSnapshotManager_C.cpp", line 703.68: CBC1013(S) Identifier "true" is undefined. "./collectors/native/java_profiler/StatelessHeapSnapshotManager_C.cpp", line 703.53: CBC1013(S) Identifier "optHeapDebug" is undefined. "./collectors/native/java_profiler/StatelessHeapSnapshotManager_C.cpp", line 706.71: CBC1013(S) Identifier "optHeapDebug" is undefined. CBC1793(I) Compilation failed for file ./collectors/native/java_profiler/StatelessHeapSnapshotManager_C.cpp. Object file not created. FSUM3065 The COMPILE step ended with return code 12. FSUM3017 Could not compile collectors/native/java_profiler/StatelessHeapSnapshotManager_C.cpp. Correct the errors and try again. make[1]: *** [collectors/native/java_profiler/StatelessHeapSnapshotManager_C.o] Error 3
The build this error occurred in was TPTP-4.1.0-200509221114 This needs to get fixed obviously. Initially, this appears to be a zOS build problem rather than a code problem. The compiler on zOS is choking on a new variable of type "bool" which was introduced into a c++ part by bugzilla 105189. The compiler is complaining that "bool" is not a type although it clearly is (zOS C/C++ language reference specifically documents "bool" as a type but only for C++ compilations). The code fragment containing the problem is *not* platform specific and the other platforms' C++ compilers are *not* complaining.
The zOS build compiles C++ parts with cxx (rather than c89 for C parts). I am checking the cxx compiler invocation to see if we have the right incantation. One suspect is the compile option "TARGET\(OSV2R10\)". I believe that option was needed for link/runtime compatability at same point in the (distant?) past. Unfortunately, if it had any bearing on the language definition itself, that would be bad for "bool" because the "bool" type was explicitly excluded from the language as implemented for the V2R10 version of the C/C++ compiler on zOS (see section 1.2.2.5 of the OS/390 V2R10.0 C/C++ Language Reference).
The TARGET option has been part of the cxx/c89 incantation in the build since time immemorial and may not be easy to eliminate at this time. One alternative would be to try to explicitly enable the bool type by using KEYWORD options: KEYWORD(bool) KEYWORD(true) KEYWORD(false) at least for the C++ parts.
Next step: some trials with the build folks to confirm or deny this as the culprit. The use of the V2R10 compiler is indeed the root of the problem. It is being used explicitly via STEPLIB in the setup script. (Note: the TARGET option sets up the compile for the corresponding V2R10 link/runtime environment but does not itself control the version of the compiler being used).
Unfortunately, while shooting this problem, we have uncovered a separate build problem that is impeding the fix/verification of the original problem. Defect 110882 has been opened to track that bug. We have gotten past the nested build problem (110882). Trials have now shown that we can't bypass the original problem by use of the KEYWORD option (that option is unsupported on the down-level compiler). We are left with having to kludge the solution by typedef'ing the "bool" type in source for zOS only. The necesary "bool" typedef was added to the StatelessHeapSnapshotManager.h header 10/03/2005 3:30pm.
The as400 build was also broken at the same time as this zOS break by the same 105189 bugzilla but in a slightly different way (related to exports and a modified constructor signature). That problem was later opened as 111359 but the fix for it was mistakenly checked in under this bugzilla (10/03/2005 1:29pm). 111359 has been marked dependent on this defect for that reason. FSUM3017 Could not compile collectors/native/java_profiler/StatelessHeapSnapshotManager_C.cpp. Correct the errors and try again. make[1]: *** [collectors/native/java_profiler/StatelessHeapSnapshotManager_C.o] Error 3
The build this error occurred in was TPTP-4.1.0-200509221114 This needs to get fixed obviously. Initially, this appears to be a zOS build problem rather than a code problem. The compiler on zOS is choking on a new variable of type "bool" which was introduced into a c++ part by bugzilla 105189. The compiler is complaining that "bool" is not a type although it clearly is (zOS C/C++ language reference specifically documents "bool" as a type but only for C++ compilations). The code fragment containing the problem is *not* platform specific and the other platforms' C++ compilers are *not* complaining.
The zOS build compiles C++ parts with cxx (rather than c89 for C parts). I am checking the cxx compiler invocation to see if we have the right incantation. One suspect is the compile option "TARGET\(OSV2R10\)". I believe that option was needed for link/runtime compatability at same point in the (distant?) past. Unfortunately, if it had any bearing on the language definition itself, that would be bad for "bool" because the "bool" type was explicitly excluded from the language as implemented for the V2R10 version of the C/C++ compiler on zOS (see section 1.2.2.5 of the OS/390 V2R10.0 C/C++ Language Reference).
The TARGET option has been part of the cxx/c89 incantation in the build since time immemorial and may not be easy to eliminate at this time. One alternative would be to try to explicitly enable the bool type by using KEYWORD options: KEYWORD(bool) KEYWORD(true) KEYWORD(false) at least for the C++ parts.
Next step: some trials with the build folks to confirm or deny this as the culprit. The use of the V2R10 compiler is indeed the root of the problem. It is being used explicitly via STEPLIB in the setup script. (Note: the TARGET option sets up the compile for the corresponding V2R10 link/runtime environment but does not itself control the version of the compiler being used).
Unfortunately, while shooting this problem, we have uncovered a separate build problem that is impeding the fix/verification of the original problem. Defect 110882 has been opened to track that bug. We have gotten past the nested build problem (110882). Trials have now shown that we can't bypass the original problem by use of the KEYWORD option (that option is unsupported on the down-level compiler). We are left with having to kludge the solution by typedef'ing the "bool" type in source for zOS only. The necesary "bool" typedef was added to the StatelessHeapSnapshotManager.h header 10/03/2005 3:30pm.
The as400 build was also broken at the same time as this zOS break by the same 105189 bugzilla but in a slightly different way (related to exports and a modified constructor signature). That problem was later opened as 111359 but the fix for it was mistakenly checked in under this bugzilla (10/03/2005 1:29pm). 111359 has been marked dependent on this defect for that reason.
