Bug.Summery: EditorService throws an assertion when given a bad IEditorInput
Source file generated by annotation processor not updated in IDE

Lines.Line: A.jar is highier on the list than B.jar so A.jar will be used at compile time.

Bug.WithStack:
If a developer has a source file open that is generated by an annotation processor and then changes the processor/factory that generated that file to a different annotation factory implementation (i.e. different jar file == different generated source file) the changes are not reflected in the open source file until it is closed and re-opened in the editor. The project is being rebuilt correctly but this is confusing to developers as they can't see the changes being made if they already have the generated source open. Clicking refresh in the ‘Package Explorer’ view does not refresh the file in the editor.
Setup steps: Create simple project with simple a class that uses an annotation like @HelloWorld. Create two seperate @HelloWorld processors, one in external Jar A.jar and the other in B.jar, make sure they generate slightly different source at compile time but with the same class and package, one can print 'Hello world A.jar' the other 'Hello World B.jar'. Add them to classpath and to the Annotation Factory Path (Right click on project/Properties/Java Compiler/Annotation Processing/Factory Path/Add External Jars). Add them so A.jar is highier on the list than B.jar so A.jar will be used at compile time.
Repro Steps: Once you have set up your simple project and can see the source file generated by the @HelloWorld annotation processor found in A.jar, open the generated source file in the IDE. Now go into project properties and change the Factory path so that B.jar is higher in the Factory path and apply the changes. This means the project will be re-built with the processor found in B.jar but the generated source displayed in the open file in the editor is still showing the old source generated by A.jar. Clicking refresh on the Package Explorer view does not fix the problem. You have to close the file and reopen it to see the newly generated file by B.jar processor.
Note: When you edit a source file outside of the IDE there is a prompt advising that ‘the file has changed on the file system. Do you want to load the changes?’ Adrian, could you attach A.jar and B.jar to this bug if you have them handy? Created attachment 28365 A.jar
This is a simple hello world Annotation factory and processor used to replicate this bug, it generates a file that contain s the phrase "A.jar". The annotation is @HelloWorldAnnotation Created attachment 28366 B.jar
Same as A.jar except generates method helloWorldB() and the prints the string "Hello, (B) world! This file produced by B.Jar" fix checked into CVS Oct 20.

Bug.Summery: [Misc] Project > Share Project... with non-project resource selected causes NPE

Lines.Line: 1) Open Eclipse with at least one *non-CVS* project in your workspace.
2) Close all editors.
3) Open any file so you have one editor open.
4) Select any "file" in any *non-CVS* project in the navigator view.
5) Close the workbench.
6) Restart Eclipse.
7) Without touching *anything*, goto Project > Share Project...

Bug.WithStack:
Open Eclipse with a non-CVS project in your workspace. Expand the project, and select a file, then exit Eclipse. Restart Eclipse (the file should still be selected, yet the Share Project menu item is enabled), and without touching the Navigator View, goto Project > Share Project... You should be greeted with a NullPointerException dialog. I've debugged this a bit (because someone is chopping off the stack). Here's the cause of the NPE:

available [native method] NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Object, Object[]) line: 39 DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Object, Object[]) line: 25 Method.invoke(Object, Object...) line: 585 Main.invokeFramework(String[], URL[]) line: 338 Main.basicRun(String[]) line: 282 Main.run(String[]) line: 977 Main.main(String[]) line: 952
Passing to team.
Fix released to HEAD Bogdan, please verify during 3.2 M3 test pass Verified in I20051101-0010 We were resolving bugs in our bug system and I thought this bug was fixed because I could no longer reproduce it. However, one of our other developers could reliably reproduce it. After some further head bashing we found out that this bug still exists iff you have an editor open when you exit Eclipse. So - to reproduce:
1) Open Eclipse with at least one *non-CVS* project in your workspace. 2) Close all editors. 3) Open any file so you have one editor open. 4) Select any "file" in any *non-CVS* project in the navigator view. 5) Close the workbench. 6) Restart Eclipse. 7) Without touching *anything*, goto Project > Share Project...
The file will be selected, and the menu item will be enabled and you will get a very weird exception dialog.
I'm able to reproduce this one. Here is the stack trace:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 0 at org.eclipse.team.internal.ui.actions.ConfigureProjectAction$1.run(ConfigureProjectAction.java:48) at org.eclipse.team.internal.ui.actions.TeamAction$2.run(TeamAction.java:237) at org.eclipse.swt.custom.BusyIndicator.showWhile(BusyIndicator.java:67) at org.eclipse.team.internal.ui.actions.TeamAction.run(TeamAction.java:234) at org.eclipse.team.internal.ui.actions.ConfigureProjectAction.execute(ConfigureProjectAction.java:45) at org.eclipse.team.internal.ui.actions.TeamAction.run(TeamAction.java:477) at org.eclipse.team.internal.ui.actions.TeamAction.runWithEvent(TeamAction.java:511) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.PluginAction.runWithEvent(PluginAction.java:246) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WWinPluginAction.runWithEvent(WWinPluginAction.java:229) at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem.handleWidgetSelection(ActionContributionItem.java:545) at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem.access$2(ActionContributionItem.java:490) at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem$5.handleEvent(ActionContributionItem.java:402) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java:66) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:938) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runDeferredEvents(Display.java:3682) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:3293) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java:2389) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runUI(Workbench.java:2353) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.access$4(Workbench.java:2219) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench$4.run(Workbench.java:466) at org.eclipse.core.databinding.observable.Realm.runWithDefault(Realm.java:289) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.createAndRunWorkbench(Workbench.java:461) at org.eclipse.ui.PlatformUI.createAndRunWorkbench(PlatformUI.java:149) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.ide.application.IDEApplication.start(IDEApplication.java:106) at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.app.EclipseAppHandle.run(EclipseAppHandle.java:153) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.runApplication(EclipseAppLauncher.java:106) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.start(EclipseAppLauncher.java:76) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:363) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:176) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source) at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:504) at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:443) at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:1169) at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:1144)
As you can see the NPE is caused because there is actually no Project selected. I can see at least two solutions for the problem: 1. Make sure that "Share Project" entry in the main menu is disabled for all non-project resources (the entry in the popup menu is disabled like it should be). 2. Modify the TeamAction#getSelectedProjects() method so it will return a project even when there is a file/folder selected. We can look for the project of a given resource. The question is why is the menu enabled in the first place. The ConfigureProjectAction#isEnabled() method clearly only returns true if a single project is selected. It appears that, on startup, there is a scenario where the isEnabled is not being called before the operation is run. This may be a bug in the workbench so we should track it down (i.e. try and debug it and confirm that isEnabled is not being called and, if confirmed, forward the bug to Platform/UI).
Having said that, we should also add a check to the execute to exit if there isn't a selected project. Yes. I have had similar issues in the past with some of my actions being enabled when they were clearly not *supposed* to be and I never did track them down. It was driving me nuts. Eventually I just decided it was a feature. ;) Although I never made the connection to an editor being open... Created attachment 73312 Fix
The check for proper selection added to the execute method. After some debugging done I can confirm that the isEnabled test is not called for the Project > Share Project... as well as for other Team Actions located in the main toolbar menu.
First, I though about disabling the menu entry (the action) after the check in the execute method fails. But I think that after forwarding the bug to Platform/UI they will find a better way to handle this case. I have released the patch to HEAD. Now that we've fixed the problem in Team, it would be good if we could create a simple example plug-in that shows the failure. We can then create a separate bug against Platform/UI and attach the example. Tomek, can you do this please. Done. The bug with a simple plug-in is here: bug 195879. Thanks. Marking the Team specific issue fixed. Verified in build I20070807-0010

Bug.Summery: properties categories are not translated
Bug.WithStack:
WTP 1.0 M8 9/17/2005
if you click within a selector tag, its properties show up in the properties view. However, you can see the categories are not translated. They show up as %css2.category-def.visual.caption %css2.category-def.aural.caption etc..
Making a quick glance at the code, it looks like the strings were supposed to be pulled in through org.eclipse.wst.css.core/cssprofile *** Bug 116210 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** This problem seemed to appear when using the css.core plugin jar instead of non-jar form (so problem didn't show up when debugging, but showed up at standalone runtime) It looks like there's difficulty finding the cssprofile.properies file. Created attachment 40322 org.eclipse.wst.css.core.patch
Needed to improve properties file lookup to handle looking up in appropriate place (plugin directory/jar, fragment directory/jar)
plugin affected -org.eclipse.wst.css.core
files modified -RegistryReader -CSSProfileImpl
RegistryReader#readElement change: String pluginId = element.getDeclaringExtension().getNamespace(); to: String pluginId = element.getContributor().getName(); change: URL url = Platform.find(bundle, path); to: URL url = FileLocator.find(bundle, path, null); change: url = Platform.asLocalURL(url); info = new CSSProfileImpl(strID, url); to: url = FileLocator.toFileURL(url); info = new CSSProfileImpl(strID, url, strURI);
Passed in original strURI so that CSSProfileImpl can work with it as well as the "localized" URL. Other changes were to fix up some deprecation calls.
CSSProfileImpl -added new package protected CSSProfileImpl constructor which takes in additional strURI paramenter -modified getResourceBundle so that instead of trying to build its own ClassLoader based on incorrectly guessing cssprofile's location (incorrectly because it was not handling jar'd plugins correctly) use platform's FileLocator.openStream() to have platform automatically figure out the appropriate classloader to use. getResourceBundle does have to figure out the potential cssprofile file names though, using Java ResourceBundle naming convention. This is because FileLocator.openStream does not correctly do this for us (despite what its javadoc says) See bug 103345 for some history on that. Thanks for digging into this Amy.
Approved.
fix released for this week's 1.5 rc2 build verified in wtp 1.5rc5

Bug.Summery: Unable to delete from model root resource elements
Bug.WithStack:
The context menu item "Delete from model" for views whose semantic element is a root resource element is always greyed out. As well, Ctrl+D does not work to delete the view and its semantic element from the model. Created attachment 27459 Modified logic model to show bug
This is a modified logic model which shows the bug. The diagram consists of a single AND gate.
Modification: Removed diagram element and corresponding semantic element. This causes the AND gate semantic element to become a root element. Sounds like the diagram infrastructure's common Delete command assumes that a Resource has a single root element, so that it should not be deletable? Changing component to "Runtime Diagram" This seems to work fine now. [GMF Restructure] Bug 319140 : product GMF and component Runtime Diagram was the original product and component for this bug

Bug.Summery: Close projects in workspace break WTP builds
Bug.WithStack:
Using 0.7M20050915 build if ANY projects in a workspace are closed then the Java Jar Dependencies preference page will not list any workspace projects (empty table). Moreover, WTP builds are incorrect (at least for new web apps) as all dependent projects are not included in the new web app build(all dependent project jars are missing). The previous dependency information, if any, is still retained in .wtpmodules. If the closed projects are opened then Java Jar Dependency pages is correct the builds proceed properly. Any closed project will cause this, even if the project is not a dependency.
It was very hard to find the scenario that causes this to happen and can cause great frustration to those who encounter it, which is why the severity was entered as critical.
This may be a separate bug but sometimes builds need to be motivated to work correctly by deselecting a dependent project (and hit apply) then reselect the dependent project and hit APPLY from the Java Jar Dependencies page. Fixed, code in CVS This bug is being moved to the "closed" state since because it has been in the fixed state for a long time it is being assumed fixed without explicit verification from the originator. If there is still a problem, in the most recent 1.5.x builds, please reopen or open another bug.

Bug.Summery: [WorkbenchParts] EditorPart#isDirty() method called 5 times upon opening.
Bug.WithStack:
Hello,
When opening an EditorPart the isDirty method is called 5 times. I am using 3.2M1. Thanks for a great tool! Actually, it's normal because of the listener pattern based architecture.
With the Text editor opening a text file, we get calls to IEditorPart#isDirty() from
3 action constructors 4 from getPart(true) (listeners) Presentation call 6 from action udpate states (listeners) 1 from a TextListener
This might be cause for updating some of the java docs.
PW
Do you mean to update the javadoc to warn that isDirty will be called many times?
That's what I was thinking ... or just close the bug with a little note explaining what's going on.
PW
I added a small note to the isDirty() interface, since the behaviour is correct.
PW
verified in RC5
PW

Bug.Summery: [Regression] File system services 4.1 client compatibility with 3.3 and 4.0 servers
Bug.WithStack:
There is currently a regression where file system service clients in 4.1 cannot successfully negotiate and transfer files with 3.3 and 4.0 file system services servers (file transfer service). This problem has a solution and I'm working to deliver a fix very soon.
[ sizing = 1 day ] Created attachment 27412 File system services compatbilities (File transfer service)
The last row in the compatibility chart attached is now functional ("o" instead of "x"). The file manager factory is smarter now and has a new provider to differentiate between provisional new and new file system services protocol on the agent controller host.
Please use the new debugging switches at run-time to get more information on the client or server parts of the file system services.
o SHOW_DEBUG = TRUE <-- set as environment variable o Programmatically on the client side only, FileSystemServices.Options.SHOW_DEBUG.setEnabled(true); As of TPTP 4.6.0, TPTP is in maintenance mode and focusing on improving quality by resolving relevant enhancements/defects and increasing test coverage through test creation, automation, Build Verification Tests (BVTs), and expanded run-time execution. As part of the TPTP Bugzilla housecleaning process (see http://wiki.eclipse.org/Bugzilla_Housecleaning_Processes), this enhancement/defect is verified/closed by the Project Lead since this enhancement/defect has been resolved and unverified for more than 1 year and considered to be fixed. If this enhancement/defect is still unresolved and reproducible in the latest TPTP release (http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/downloads/), please re-open.

Bug.Summery: Infer Generic Type Arguments produces invalid code
Delete source folder -> C/C++ Projects view update broken

Lines.Line: 1. Place the Navigator view next to the C/C++ Projects view so you can see both
at the same time.
2. Create a standard C project.
3. Add a new folder.
4. Add a new source folder.
5. Now delete the source folder. The Navigator view updates correctly, but the
C/C++ Projects view moves the source folder resource to the bottom, although the
file system folder has been deleted.
6. Close the project.
7. Open the project. Now the deleted source folder is no longer visible in the
C/C++ Projects view.
This bug is unreproducible with CDT 4.0.
(In reply to comment #1)
> This bug is unreproducible with CDT 4.0.

Bug.Summery: Job selection
Bug.WithStack:
The job will be selected if click on job (not on checkbox). The highlight is removed on the selected job and the checkbox is used to present whether the job is selected ot not. Actually there is a problem to hightlight the selected job and unhightlight the unselected job. Then I removed all hightlight on selection. Please remove checkbox altogether. It makes the interface too confusing. Use the same technique to unselect all jobs that is used in the package explorer when you click on the empty part of the view - i.e. it unselects all folders. (In reply to comment #1) > Please remove checkbox altogether. It makes the interface too confusing. Use the same technique to > unselect all jobs that is used in the package explorer when you click on the empty part of the view - i.e. it > unselects all folders.
I will do again. By the way, I cannot undeslect all folders in the package explorer if click on the empty part of the view. I think there is a difference between windows and mac.
I suggest using the 'click in empty part of window to clear selection' for Mac/Linux and 'click on selected item to clear selection' for Windows. I have removed the checkbox in job view. If the mouse is clicked on empty part of view, it will deselect all jobs. Please check it. Also I added a popup menu for removing the finished job from the view. You can right click on the job and then the popup menu will be displayed. If the job is still running, the menu will be disabled. Until the job is finished or terminated, the menu item will be enabled when you right click on the job. After you clicked the menu item, the selected job will be removed from the job view and then refresh the view. See if it is okay.
(In reply to comment #3) > I suggest using the 'click in empty part of window to clear selection' for Mac/Linux and 'click on selected > item to clear selection' for Windows.
Selection seems to work fine (at least on a Mac - I haven't tested on other platforms).
For the remove jobs pop, I would suggest just a single menu item for "Remove All Terminated" that pops up anywhere (on a job or on the empty view). This is the same as in the debug view. I have changed what you want. User can select the job to remove it in the previous design, now I changed to remove all stopped jobs in job view.
(In reply to comment #5) > Selection seems to work fine (at least on a Mac - I haven't tested on other platforms). > > For the remove jobs pop, I would suggest just a single menu item for "Remove All Terminated" that pops > up anywhere (on a job or on the empty view). Bug.Summery: Garbage data appears in DB2 data set when previewed.

Lines.Line: 1. Create a DB2 data source and related data set in which there is chinese
character.
2. Bind the data set to a table.
3. Preview.

Bug.WithStack:
Description: Garbage data appears in DB2 data set when previewed.
Steps to reproduce: 1. Create a DB2 data source and related data set in which there is chinese character. 2. Bind the data set to a table. 3. Preview.
Actual result: garbage data appears. Please see detailed explanation in bug109030.
Db2 Universal Database v7.2: the default character encoding is determined by the operating system, which in this case is utf8. Data has not been inserted properly though which is against the second rule. verified in build 20051018 Verified in build 20051107.
Bug.WithOutStack:
Description: Garbage data appears in DB2 data set when previewed.
Steps to reproduce: 1. Create a DB2 data source and related data set in which there is chinese character. 2. Bind the data set to a table. 3. Preview.
Actual result: garbage data appears. Please see detailed explanation in bug109030.
Db2 Universal Database v7.2: the default character encoding is determined by the operating system, which in this case is utf8. Data has not been inserted properly though which is against the second rule. verified in build 20051018 Verified in build 20051107.

Bug.Summery: Update base builder to get latest JDT compiler
Bug.WithStack:
I believe latest is r311_vM20050914-1235
This suffices for our 0.7.1 build, and current 1.0 stream builds, but when we start 1.5 stream, we should have seperate base builder for it (based on 3.2 stream JDT compiler)
and maintenance releases of 0.7.1 or 1.0 continue to use 3.1.1 based base-builder. Also, which build.properties can we update to get version printed in compile log?
# This parameter is specific to the compiler # being used (JDT Compiler, in our case). # 'showversion' causes the version of JDT Compiler to be # printed to the compiler log file. compilerArg=-showversion I did update base builder, to r311_vM20050914-1235 Confirmed in an "S" build, that JDT compiler went from Eclipse Java Compiler 0.567, pre-3.1.0 release candidate-3 to Eclipse Java Compiler 0.570, 3.1.0 release
Have not re-run 0.7.1 M build yet. Hopefully someone knows a property file to update? If not, we'll simply re-run, and mark this bug as fixed.
I did setup a task in the build target to export a tagged version of the basebuilder with each build from CVS. I will add the tag to the build.cfg so that we can use different basdebuilders with different types of builds.
I'm not sure I understand comment #3. The base builder I'm talking about is what is in org.eclipse.releng.basebuilder
I've seen eclipseBuildURL added to build.cfg, and not sure how its used, but it points to http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops/M20050923-1430/
I'm not sure if I'm missing the obvious, or just need it spelled out for me.
I assume it is still org.eclipse.releng.basebuilder that does our build? (that is, its version of PDE build, and JDT compiler are used). I realize there's another "classpath" that determines the java libraries used, but that's different than this bugzilla.
And, BTW, org.eclipse.releng.basebuilder has been updated on build machine, as per pervious comemnts, but ...
Given above, I'd like to remove confusion by getting compilerArg=-showversion in the right build.properties that puts JDT compiler version in the compiler output. Which build.properties is it?
I think the adding the following properties will do it (look for the compilerArg property).
For 0.7.1, in releng.builder\scripts\build.xml, add the line in red:
<ant antfile="build.xml" dir="${pde.build.scripts}" > <property name="builder" value="${basedir}/../components/${component}" /> <property name="relengDir" value="${basedir}/.." /> <property name="compilerArg" value="-showversion"/> </ant>

Bug.Summery: java.util.zip.ZipException: error in opening zip file

Stacktrace.Reason: error in opening zip file Can't open archive: struts.jar: java.util.zip.ZipException: error in opening zip file org.aspectj.weaver.BCException: Can't open archive: struts.jar: java.util.zip.ZipException: error in opening zip file

Bug.WithStack:
I'm trying to upgrade from AspectJ1.2.1 to AspectJ1.5. I'm trying to aspectize a jar and make a new jar. But this is working fine in AspectJ1.2.1 even now. But this problem occurs in aspectJ1.5. Is thr any workaround for this
---- Compiler Messages --- abort ABORT -- (BCException) Can't open archive: struts.jar: java.util.zip.ZipException: error in opening zip file Can't open archive: struts.jar: java.util.zip.ZipException: error in opening zip file org.aspectj.weaver.BCException: Can't open archive: struts.jar: java.util.zip.ZipException: error in opening zip file at org.aspectj.weaver.bcel.ClassPathManager$ZipFileEntry.ensureOpen (ClassPathManager.java:253) at org.aspectj.weaver.bcel.ClassPathManager$ZipFileEntry.find (ClassPathManager.java:225) at org.aspectj.weaver.bcel.ClassPathManager.find (ClassPathManager.java:92) at org.aspectj.weaver.bcel.BcelWorld.lookupJavaClass (BcelWorld.java:259) at org.aspectj.weaver.bcel.BcelWorld.resolveDelegate (BcelWorld.java:234) at org.aspectj.weaver.World.resolveToReferenceType(World.java:282) at org.aspectj.weaver.World.resolve(World.java:205) at org.aspectj.weaver.World.resolve(World.java:127) at org.aspectj.weaver.World.resolve(World.java:250) at org.aspectj.ajdt.internal.core.builder.AjBuildManager.initBcelWorld (AjBuildManager.java:594) at org.aspectj.ajdt.internal.core.builder.AjBuildManager.doBuild (AjBuildManager.java:189) at org.aspectj.ajdt.internal.core.builder.AjBuildManager.batchBuild (AjBuildManager.java:140) at org.aspectj.ajdt.ajc.AjdtCommand.doCommand(AjdtCommand.java:112) at org.aspectj.ajdt.ajc.AjdtCommand.runCommand(AjdtCommand.java:60) at org.aspectj.tools.ajc.Main.run(Main.java:324) at org.aspectj.tools.ajc.Main.runMain(Main.java:238) at org.aspectj.tools.ajc.Main.main(Main.java:82)
---- org.aspectj.weaver.bcel.BcelWorld ---- Hmmm, is struts.jar definetly a valid jar file? you can unzip/unjar it OK outside of AspectJ? Is this only happening on solaris like the other bug, or is it also happening on windows?
All the code that is failing is basically doing is:
zipFile = new ZipFile(new File("struts.jar"))
Aspectj hasn't even had a chance to touch the contents of it by the time it goes wrong. No this is happening even in windows when i tried with AspectJ1.5. But itz working quite fine when i tried with Ver1.2.1. Is thr any work around for this.. I was stuck up in the middle as i'm unable to change completely to Ver1.5 because of this kind of error nor i cudn't proceed with 1.2.1 because of that internal compiler error
But have you tried opening the struts.jar outside of AspectJ, just on the command line - is the jar OK??
It is possible that extra processing in AspectJ5 is requiring us to open that jar where we didn't bother previously - under AspectJ1.2.1 we may never have tried to open it.
All I can suggest is moving struts.jar to the end of your classpath - AspectJ is not necessarily looking for a class from that archive, it is just opening all the jars on the classpath in turn trying to find something. Yeah. I'm manually able to open tht jar. But this is not the case only with struts.jar. I'm getting this error for all the jars that i'm tryin to aspectize..
FWIW, I've verified that I can open (and weave) struts.jar on Windows with AJ 5. Is this still a problem for you? Finally I recreated this today by accident. It occurs if the output jar you are writing to is on your classpath !! or if a jar on the classpath is zero size - which happens if you have it as the outjar - we open the file to write to then attempt to open it when resolving something from the classpath, bang. investigate if still a problem for 1.5.4 per my comments 7 and 8, I think this is addressed now in AspectJ1.6 as those situations are now checked. please reopen if still an issue.

Bug.Summery: New API package is not listed in the manifest.mf
Bug.WithStack:
Build: I-20050922-1200
The new API package (org.eclipse.pde.ui.launcher) is not listed in the Export- Package header of pde.ui's manifest.mf.
This will break all products that provide a profiler for the Eclipse Application and Plugin JUnit launchers. Fixed.
Bug.WithOutStack:
Build: I-20050922-1200
The new API package (org.eclipse.pde.ui.launcher) is not listed in the Export- Package header of pde.ui's manifest.mf.
This will break all products that provide a profiler for the Eclipse Application and Plugin JUnit launchers. Fixed.

Bug.Summery: G2X: Fail to drag components into the logic editor

Lines.Line: 1. Create a simple project in the workspace
2. Go to File -> New -> Example -> GEF -> Logic Diagram and create an empty
model file
3. In the Logic Graphic Editor, launch the palette by click the Show Palette
icon
4. Drag a 'HalfAdder' or 'FullAdder' (under Canned Parts) from the palette to
the canvas
1. Create a folder 'IES'
2. Extract Eclipse files into IES directory
3. set LD_LIBRARY_PATH by the command 'export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/IES/eclipse'
4. Re-run the scenario, the same problem occurs.

Bug.WithStack:
OS: RHEL 4.0 update 2 / Windows 2000 Build level: M20050915 JDK version: IBM JDK 1.4.2 SR2
Summary: G2X: Fail to drag components into the logic editor
Steps to recreate problem: 1. Create a simple project in the workspace 2. Go to File -> New -> Example -> GEF -> Logic Diagram and create an empty model file 3. In the Logic Graphic Editor, launch the palette by click the Show Palette icon 4. Drag a 'HalfAdder' or 'FullAdder' (under Canned Parts) from the palette to the canvas
<<Error>> An error messageg is pop up - 'An error has occurred. See error log fro more details.' If we close the workbench, a JVM error msg is pop up and javacore.xxxxx.txt file is generated.
NOTE: The problem occurs on both RHEL 4.0 update 2 and Windows 2000
<<Expected Result>> Components should be dragged into the canvas successfully. Created attachment 27420 javacore.xxx.txt file Created attachment 27421 JVM error msg Created attachment 27422 Error pop up while drag a 'HalfAdder' to canvas It sounds like the Cairo library is not being found. Please add it to your ld_library_path. And you'll need GDI+ on Windows 2000. I reopen this bug because the same problem occurs after add Cairo library to ld_library_path. If the steps below are wrong, please change the status back.
I downloaded cairo-1.0.0.tar.gz from http://www.cairographics.org/releases/
On linux, I extracted the .gz file to a directory 'Cairo' and add it to the ld_library_path by the command 'export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/Cairo/cairo-1.0.0'
The same problem still occurs in Eclipse.
Are the steps above correct? If the steps are incorrect, Could you please advise the detail configuration steps? Thanks a lot.
The version of Cairo for 3.1 ships with 3.1. Perhaps the readme mentioned something about it. I've never used it myself. You need Cairo 0.4 for Eclipse 3.1.1. It ships with the Eclipse build, so I believe all you need to do is set LD_LIBRARY_PATH to the base eclipse directory. I still got the same problem, following are my configration steps: 1. Create a folder 'IES' 2. Extract Eclipse files into IES directory 3. set LD_LIBRARY_PATH by the command 'export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/IES/eclipse' 4. Re-run the scenario, the same problem occurs.
NOTE: At step 3, I also tried 'export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/IES', but it did't work.
If the steps above are wrong, could you please advise the detail steps? Thanks a lot.
Please don't reopen the bug to ask a question. There is not a bug. Here is the message from the SWT team about using Cairo: http://dev.eclipse.org/newslists/news.eclipse.platform.swt/msg22062.html Tiffany, you're using Motif, right?
At step 3, you should be doing: export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/IES/eclipse Randy/Pratik, We did add eclipse base directory to the library path. But the problem still exists. Besides, we encountered the same problem on RHEL 4 update2, windows 2000 SP4 and SLES 9. Is there any possible that it is not a problem related to Cairo library? Thank You. IF the problem only happens for half and full adder, it is because those parts have connections, and connection are rendered using anti-aliasing, and anti- aliasing requires Cairo.
Try dropping two LEDs and connecting them. If it fails when you try to connect them, Cairo is still missing. comment 0 mentions that when the parts are added to the canvas, an error message pops up saying "An error has occurred. See error log for more details." What is that error in the error log? Created attachment 27662 geflog.zip All the error logs displayed in Error Log View is attached in the file named geflog.zip. The problem still exists after export LD_LIBRARY_PATH. (export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=\IES\eclipse)
In the logs, we found the msg: 'org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Unable to load graphics library [Cairo is required](java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: /IES928/eclipse/configuration/ org.eclipse.osgi/bundles/9/1/.cp/libswt-cairo-gtk-3206.so (libcairo.so.2: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory))'
According to the logs, the problem may because it can't find 'libcairo.so.2'. There is no such a file named "libcairo.so.2" in my test environment (RHEL 4 update 2), there is only 'libcairo.so.1' under eclipse folder.
To fix this problem, we might need to have the proper file include in eclipse? Please provide your suggestion. Thank You!! Hmm, looks like you're using GTK, not Motif. I was under the impression that, for 3.1.1, you didn't have to do anything to make Cairo work on GTK.
CCing Billy from the SWT team for comment. Actually ccing Billy this time. OK there is some confusion in this bug. The first problem, the crash, does not seem to have to do with Cairo at all. It is crashing because of a bad pointer during a call to getMonitor() when opening a dialog. Furthermore, while this bug was reported against M20050915, the crash log is with SWT 3205, which indicates a recent I-build and not 3.1.1.
Eclipse 3.2 requires cairo 1.0 (which has a binary named cairo.so.2 while old versions are cairo.so.1). We currently still ship a (now useless) cairo.so.1 in the 3.2 stream, see bug 110924. Note that cairo-1.0.0.tar.gz is the source release and must be compiled before you can use it, see the INSTALL file in that archive. Reassigning to SWT to investigate the original crash. Is this still reproducable? Billy, if the reporter is [incorrectly] using a 3.2 version of Eclipse, then I am sure they do not have Cairo 1.0 installed. This is still user error.
Cam, this is not the first time testers have been using GEF with the wrong pre- reqs. Please get this under control. Tiffany - can you change the ld_library_path to use the correct version of the Cairo library that matches with 3.1.1 and try the steps again? Based on Billy's comment #19 and the error message you received (see your comment #16) it sounds like the correct version is 'libcairo.so.1'. BB, please unmuddle this. If there is a crash in getMonitor(), open a bug report with the stack trace. If the problem is the wrong Cairo library, link this bug to the one that is tracking this issue. Tiffany Lu: I think you need to tell me what you want to be investigated here.
The original crash in this bug is with I20050913-0800 (3.2 before M2), is it reproducable with M2 or newer? For M20050929-0840 build, it needs libcairo.so.1. After 'export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/IES/eclipse/', the problem doesn't exist.
For I20050923-1000 build, it needs libcairo.so.2. we refer to comment #19, follow the INSTALL file to install Cairo 1.0 under '/Cairo/cairo-1.0.0' folder, then libcairo.so.2 can be found under '/Cairo/cairo-1.0.0/src/.libs'. After 'export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/Cairo/cairo-1.0.0/src/.libs' then re-run the scenairo, the problem doesn't exist.
Since the problem does not exist on v3.1.1 and the problem on v3.2 is reported by bug 110942, we would like to close this bug. Please help to update the status and we may close it. Thanks. Sorry! There is a typo in the previous comment, it should be "Since the problem does not exist on v3.1.1 and the problem on v3.2 is reported by bug 110924, we would like to close this bug. Please help to update the status and we may close it. Thanks." Thanks, closing. As Comment #26, close the bug. Thanks.

Bug.Summery: true/false properties should use checkbox
Bug.WithStack: It would need less mouse clicks to change true/false property values if the "properties" propertysheet displayed a checkbox for these values in the "value" column.
Bug.WithOutStack: It would need less mouse clicks to change true/false property values if the "properties" propertysheet displayed a checkbox for these values in the "value" column.
